since_last_update: Dominant macro impulse: US January CPI printed cooler (headline ~2.4% y/y; core ~2.5% y/y), reinforcing disinflation and pulling Treasury yields lower into the Friday close; equities stabilized but Nasdaq remained softer vs S&P (Barron's, AP).

Narrative shift: market is leaning more into “rate-cuts later in 2026” after the CPI, with a flatter/softer yields backdrop supporting duration assets (tech long-duration and gold) but not fully offsetting ongoing AI/mega-cap de-risking (Barron's, MarketWatch).

Microstructure/calendar: heading into a US holiday closure (Presidents Day, Monday Feb 16, 2026) which can concentrate risk into thinner pre-holiday sessions and amplify gaps into Tuesday reopen (calendar reporting).
today_focus: Primary driver check (today/session): rates repricing via softer CPI -> lower yields/real-yield impulse remains the cleanest cross-asset driver (supports gold and duration equities), but equity index upside is being capped by continued AI-capex/AI-disruption drawdown in mega-cap tech (Barron's, MarketWatch).

Index-futures leadership: expect ES to be more resilient than NQ if the tape remains ‘lower-yields but tech-degrossing’ (inference from sector dispersion noted in post-CPI session behavior; Nasdaq lagging despite softer yields) (Barron's, AP).

Gold focus: gold bid is consistent with falling yields / easier policy expectations; watch for any rebound in real yields or USD strength as the near-term risk to the bid (Barron's; mechanism inference).

Positioning/flow: pre-holiday risk management + recent volatility in mega-cap tech increases odds of correlation spikes and air-pockets, particularly in NQ (inference; consistent with ongoing AI-capex fear coverage) (MarketWatch).

market_pricing.dominant_driver: Rates repricing after cooler CPI (yields down) competing with AI/mega-cap tech de-risking; net effect = cross-asset support from rates, but equity upside constrained by tech-specific risk premia.

equities.es_nq_skew: S&P more balanced/defensive; Nasdaq relatively heavier drag from AI-capex/AI-disruption narrative despite rates relief (inference from reported index/sector behavior).
equities.breadth_style: Rotation toward defensives and rate-sensitive non-tech beneficiaries (e.g., utilities/REIT-style sensitivity) alongside selective tech weakness (Barron's).

rates.front_end: Market leaning toward additional easing later in 2026 after CPI; near-term path still data-dependent (Barron's).
rates.real_yields_impulse: Downward pressure post-CPI is supportive for gold and long-duration equities; reversal risk if subsequent inflation prints re-accelerate (inference).

fx.usd_bias: Potential softer USD bias if easing expectations build; not confirmed as dominant today (inference; driver-dependent).

commodities.gold: Supported by lower yields/easing expectations; vulnerable to any quick snapback in yields/real rates (Barron's; mechanism inference).

volatility.eq_vol: Elevated relative to ‘stable macro’ because the AI-capex narrative is a sector-specific shock that can raise index vol through mega-cap weights (MarketWatch; inference).

risk_register.risk: CPI-driven dovish repricing proves fragile (base effects / one-off components); any hotter follow-up data forces a fast rates unwind (yields up), pressuring NQ and potentially gold via higher real yields.
risk_register.timeframe: Next 1–3 weeks (into next key inflation prints / Fed communications)

risk_register.risk: AI-capex/AI-disruption narrative deepens into a broader megacap de-grossing; index-level downside transmission via concentrated weights (NQ especially) even if macro data is benign.
risk_register.timeframe: Now through late February (into major AI/semis earnings)

risk_register.risk: Holiday-thinned liquidity and post-holiday gap risk: headline sensitivity increases and intraday depth can be poor, amplifying moves in ES/NQ and gold futures around any surprise macro/policy headlines.
risk_register.timeframe: Feb 14–Feb 18 (through Presidents Day closure and reopen)

risk_register.risk: Cross-asset correlation snap: a sharp move in yields (auction dynamics / risk-off bid) cascades into equities and gold simultaneously, raising hedging error for balanced books.

event_warnings: US markets closed Monday Feb 16, 2026 (Presidents Day) -> watch for compressed liquidity and higher gap risk into Tuesday Feb 17 reopen (calendar reporting).
Key macro cluster next week: US Retail Sales (Tue Feb 17) and FOMC Minutes (Wed Feb 18) are plausible catalysts for front-end repricing and equity duration sensitivity (economic calendar listings).
Earnings/catalyst concentration: Nvidia earnings on Feb 25 is increasingly framed as a bellwether for AI spending/ROI concerns that are currently pressuring mega-cap tech (Barron's, MarketWatch).
